intro: Loxocarpus alatus, commonly known as the spreading thimbleweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Loxocarpus alatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a subject of ecological study.
